intro: Matthiola incana subsp. melitensis, commonly known as the Maltese stock, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Malta. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, four-petaled flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped, hairy, and aromatic, contributing to its distinct appearance. This species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
